result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R Russo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Upon successful completion of probation and payment of all fines and court costs, defendant to petition the Court for expungment.
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages   DNA sample unless already done.
AODA assessment and treatment w/any necessary followup

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam R Russo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam R Russo in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of guilty to Count 2 and Count 1 in 16CM137 is DRI.  16TR594, 16TR596 and 16TR595 are DRI.  Deft enters a plea of guilty to 16TR549.    Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
16CM137 - Count 2.
9 months probation w/held sentence can be served in another county - to be setup by agent
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
  DNA sample unless already done.
AODA assessment and treatment
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages 


16TR549 - OWI 1st.
$812.00 fine  30 dtp 6 pts
AODA assessment and treatment
DL revoked for 6 months w/credit for admin suspension


Case recalled at 11:05 am.  State would like the judgment not to be entered so that expungement could be discussed.  Court directs the clerk not to process the JOC at this time.  Will try to get back on the record today.  Court agrees that the deft does not need to be present.

Case recalled again at 11:11 am.  Atty Runyon is present in the courtroom.  State addresses with the court the issue with expungement.  Defense attorney does not oppose expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successfuly completion of probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 30, 2017 at 10:00 am.
no alcohol if in possession of a firearm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2016 at 09:20 am.
no alcohol if in possession of a firearm.

Defendant Adam R Russo in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearanced.  Complaint not read.  not guilty plea bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 09:20 am.
